These shoes are amazing!!  I wear a 10.5 (in Nike) and got the 10. They fit great. 评论概述: Ask Yourself If You Have Fat Feet Before Ordering
类型: Size: 13 WideColor: W85 Classic Black Gum
评论详情: My foot measures 11.5 inches exactly, which falls between 12.5 and 13 on the size chart. I sized up, which was the wrong decision. I should have sized down, and not because of the length or width, but because of the generous girth of the shoes. On a normal shoe this isn’t a problem, but this shoe does not have a floating tongue, so when I attempt to snug them up, I have to “fold” the tongue. I would have returned them if I had noticed at the onset, but they are stretching out with every wear, and getting worse. I have wide feet, but not fat feet. I wish I would have known before wearing them out, and not being able to return them.

These are some of my favorite shoes. I like the minimalist zero drop shoes. With a wide toe box my toes are comfortable with no pinching. People who like walking barefoot will like these shoes.

These were a great find. I was skeptical because of the brand and price, so I have waited 5 months to write this review.  I am a woman with big, wide feet. Finding shoes is a pain, as not many styles are offered in a Women’s 11W. I often resort to buying men’s shoes in gender-neutral styles.  I always wear a women’s 11W, but for some reason I always need a 10 to 10.5 in men’s shoes. I first ordered these in a 10, but they were too big. I sized down to a 9 and the length is perfect.  My husband has a 9 in the regular width of these shoes. They are slightly too narrow on me. These are slightly too wide, but still wearable.  The shoes are a great material and very stylish. They show minimal wear after 5 months. (I only wear them 1-2 times a week.)  The only con is my big toenail sometimes gets sore wearing these. The same thing happens with Crocs. I think it’s due to the up and down roominess of both kinds of shoes.  Overall, I definitely recommend this particular style.

评论概述: The only shoes that don't hurt my feet!
评论详情: I have very flat wide feet, shoes are always a pain to figure out for myself, plenty of them just leave me sore after hours of use. These shoes however are amazing! I have been able to walk miles in a day with no problem, all completely painless. I have been able to walk more, for longer, than with any other shoe I have worn before.  I have used them so much in my every day to day that I have gone through two pairs in 2 years until I run down the sole from using them too much. I don't take this as a drawback because I ruin the soles of my shoes in every single one of my shoes on the same spot and switching my shoes each year is the recommended sanitary practice so I don't mind, especially when the price of these is very affordable in comparison to other orthopedic clunky shoes.  Super comfortable to wear, I wish they had more style for different occasions, weathers and outfits but overall I am incredibly satisfied and I don't think I'll switch to another pair any time soon.

评论概述: Still trying to see if I can work with these
评论详情: UPDATE: I LOVE THEM AND KEPT THEM! Guys I am 315lbs and I was so accustomed to having lots of padding in my shoes because of my spine issues but let me tell you that even though you can feel everything on the floor from these shoes, it gives a support that actually feels really good and helps minimize my pain. I might start off in pain but then the pain goes away versus with sketchers foam shoes I start off with minimal pain or none and end up in pain. They even make me walk more inverted I feel which is what I believe in aligns my spine and that's why I end up in more pain. 5 stars for sure!  These shoes are amazing for walking and I have back problems. Yesterday I went to a museum with other shoes and my back was killing me. I came home and I had to walk my dog and I put these shoes on to test them out and it actually helped minimize my back pay and I was able to walk better. However, today I tested them out again and I have a pain in the back of my right foot because the shoe is digging into it now. I did notice yesterday that this is a wide shoe but somehow my foot is still being squeezed from in front around the ankle area of the tongue of the shoe and I thought I could live with this if I make some slits but the shoe the way that it's made. If you make slits you make slits in the whole shoe because there is no tongue. It's just one material or one piece for the whole shoe plus a second piece that makes for the shoelaces. So if I were to cut slits on the tongue then the whole shoe is compromised. Again, I'm very divided because these shoes feel great on the bottom of my feet walking and even help my posture my back pain. So I will let you know and give you an update on what I decide

I got them for working out (stuff like deadlifting), but now I wear them everywhere. I like the way they feel, super lightweight, toe box is actually wide, and they don’t look weird like other barefooter shoes. I also removed the soles once I got them. I will say, it definitely is an experience the first time you wear them outside. You can feel the majority of stuff you step on (rocks, sticks, etc), but you get used to it pretty fast.

I wish they had just a bit more durability to them, but really they are so good. They lasted him over a year though, so that’s pretty good. My son had foot pain constantly before I got them for him and he hasn’t complained of it since he got them! They are so lightweight and well cushioned.

I've been using minimalist shoes for hiking ever since Nike 5 finger shoes, and these Whitins have been the ones I like best. The uppers are made of a very tough, woven material that breathes, and the shoe also has no tongue which makes them so easy and nice to slide on. And even though the shoe has laces, the material of the uppers has just enough stretch to allow pulling them on without even messing with the laces. I was initially surprised this worked so well, but now I rarely ever untie the laces. A remarkable shoe.
